comments: a(n) > 1 if and only if n is composite. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jan 04 2013
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
formula: a(n) = Product_{ d divides n, d < n } d^phi(n/d). - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 07 2013a(n) = A067911(n) / n. - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 07 2013Product_{j=1..n} Product_{k=1..j-1} GCD(j,k), n >= 1. - _Daniel Forgues_, Apr 11 2013a(n) = sqrt( (1/n) * (A092287(n) / A092287(n-1)) ). - _Daniel Forgues_, Apr 13 2013
maple: A051190 := proc(n) local i; mul(igcd(n, i ), i = 1..(n-1)) end;
mathematica: a[n_] := If[PrimeQ[n], 1, Times @@ (GCD[n, #]& /@ Range[n-1])]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 39}]  (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Jul 18 2012 *)Table[Times @@ GCD[n, Range[n-1]], {n, 50}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Apr 12 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)a051190 n = product $ map (gcd n) [1..n-1]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 22 2011(PARI) a(n)=my(f=factor(n)); prod(i=1, #f[,1], prod(j=1, f[i,2], f[i,1]^(n\f[i,1]^j)))/n \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jan 04 2013(Sage)A051190 = lambda n: mul(gcd(n,i) for i in (1..n-1))[A051190(n) for n in (1..39)] # _Peter Luschny_, Apr 07 2013(Sage)# A second, faster version, based on the prime factorization of a(n):def A051190(n):    R = 1    if not is_prime(n) :        for p in primes(n//2+1):            s = 0; r = n; t = n-1            while r > 0 :                r = r//p; t = t//p                s += (r-t)*(r+t-1)            R *= p^(s/2)    return R[A051190(i) for i in (1..1000)]  # _Peter Luschny_, Apr 08 2013(PARI) a(n) = prod(k=1,n-1,gcd(k,n)); /* _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 14 2013 */
author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 21 1999
